org.apache.juneau.json

Class JsonParserSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Session
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanSession
        • org.apache.juneau.parser.ParserSession
          • org.apache.juneau.json.JsonParserSession

  • public final class JsonParserSession
extends ParserSession
    Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of JsonParser.

    This class is NOT thread safe. It is meant to be discarded after one-time use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonParserSession

        public JsonParserSession(JsonParserContext ctx,
                         ObjectMap op,
                         Object input,
                         Method javaMethod,
                         Object outer,
                         Locale locale,
                         TimeZone timeZone,
                         MediaType mediaType)
        Create a new session using properties specified in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The context creating this session object. The context contains all the configuration settings for this object.
        input - The input. Can be any of the following types:
        • null
        • Reader
        • CharSequence
        • InputStream containing UTF-8 encoded text.
        • File containing system encoded text.
        op - The override properties. These override any context properties defined in the context.
        javaMethod - The java method that called this parser, usually the method in a REST servlet.
        outer - The outer object for instantiating top-level non-static inner classes.
        locale - The session locale. If null, then the locale defined on the context is used.
        timeZone - The session timezone. If null, then the timezone defined on the context is used.
        mediaType - The session media type (e.g. "application/json").

    • Method Detail

      • getReader

        public ParserReader getReader()
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ParserSession
        Wraps the specified input object inside a reader. Subclasses can override this method to implement their own readers.
        Overrides:
        getReader in class ParserSession
        Returns:
        The input object wrapped in a Reader, or null if the object is null.
        Throws:
        Exception - If object could not be converted to a reader.

      • isWhitespace

        public final boolean isWhitespace(int cp)
        Returns true if the specified character is whitespace.

        The definition of whitespace is different for strict vs lax mode. Strict mode only interprets 0x20 (space), 0x09 (tab), 0x0A (line feed) and 0x0D (carriage return) as whitespace. Lax mode uses Character.isWhitespace(int) to make the determination.

        Parameters:
        cp - The codepoint.
        Returns:
        true if the specified character is whitespace.

      • isCommentOrWhitespace

        public final boolean isCommentOrWhitespace(int cp)
        Returns true if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
        Parameters:
        cp - The codepoint.
        Returns:
        true if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.

        public Map<String,Object> getLastLocation()
        Description copied from class: ParserSession
        Returns information used to determine at what location in the parse a failure occurred.
        Overrides:
        getLastLocation in class ParserSession
        Returns:
        A map, typically containing something like {line:123,column:456,currentProperty:"foobar"}
